titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with Henry L. Douglass, 1981 November 11, excerpt 07

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: HNIOHDouglassH audio cassette recording converted to mp3 format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville doctor and urologist Henry L. Douglass, conducted on 11 November 1981 by Ophelia Paine as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Douglass discusses going overseas to serve for two years during World War II. He was one of about 1000 American doctors sent to serve with the British Army. The complete interview, as well an index, is available in the Special Collections Division.

titleInfo.title: Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project
